title: Basic example
text: use simulated Markov transition matrix representing student learning behavior transitions across nine states.

title: Basic example
code: splot(mat, node_size = 9, theme = "dark", title = "Dark") splot(mat, node_size = 9, theme = "minimal", title = "Minimal") splot(mat, node_size = 9, theme = "colorblind", title = "Colorblind")

title: Basic example
code: splot(mat, layout = "circle", node_size = 9,       node_shape = c("circle", "square", "triangle", "diamond",                      "star", "pentagon", "hexagon", "heart", "circle"),       node_fill = palette_colorblind(9))

title: Basic example
code: splot(mat, node_size = 9, edge_labels = TRUE,       edge_label_size = 0.6,       edge_positive_color = "#1976D2",       edge_negative_color = "#D32F2F",       donut_fill = runif(9),       donut_color = palette_rainbow(9),       theme = "minimal")

title: Basic example
code: splot(mat, node_size = 9, filetype = "png",       filename = "network", width = 8, height = 8)

title: Confidence Interval and p-value Demo

title: Multi-Group, Multi-Cluster, and Multilevel Networks

title: Multi-Group, Multi-Cluster, and Multilevel Networks

title: Multi-Group, Multi-Cluster, and Multilevel Networks

title: Migrating from qgraph to splot
text: splot() primary plotting engine cograph. renders network graphs using base R graphics designed work across wide range use cases: transition networks learning analytics, correlation networks psychology, social networks, weighted unweighted graph structure. accepts adjacency matrices, edge lists, igraph objects, tna objects, qgraph objects directly, fits existing workflows without requiring format conversion. function built useful every stage analysis. single call like splot(mat) produces clean, readable plot sensible defaults. need , function supports confidence interval underlays edges, significance stars derived p-values, templated edge labels combine estimates CI ranges stars (e.g., 0.25*** [0.12, 0.38]), pie donut charts nodes, publication-quality export 600 DPI. goal need switch tools analysis moves exploration final manuscript figure.

title: Migrating from qgraph to splot
text: One deliberate choices splot() consistent, predictable parameter naming system. Every parameter prefixed element controls – node_, edge_, label_, donut_, pie_, edge_label_, edge_ci_ – followed property: size, color, fill, width, alpha, . node_fill node fill color, edge_label_size edge label font size, donut_border_color donut border color, edge_ci_alpha confidence interval underlay transparency. naming designed learn pattern, can guess parameter names without checking documentation. contrasts conventions like vsize, posCol, border.width, label.cex, pieColor, every parameter follows different convention needs memorized individually.

title: Migrating from qgraph to splot
text: Network plots research often need communicate uncertainty significance alongside graph structure . splot() treats first-class concern rather afterthought. Edges can carry confidence interval underlays (edge_ci) – semi-transparent bands behind edge whose width reflects uncertainty estimate. Edge labels can built templates (edge_label_template) using placeholders like {est}, stars, {low}, {}, {range}, {p}, filled vectors CI bounds p-values supply. Significance stars computed automatically p-values edge_label_stars = TRUE. features mean single splot() call can produce network every edge shows weight, significance level, confidence interval – information otherwise require post-processing manual annotation.

title: Migrating from qgraph to splot
text: splot() accepts square adjacency matrices, data frames edge lists (, , weight columns), igraph objects, cograph network objects, tna objects, qgraph objects. users migrating qgraph, from_qgraph() function converts fitted qgraph object splot parameters, tplot() provides wrapper accepts qgraph-style parameter names (vsize, edge.labels, posCol) smoother transition.

title: Modern Network Visualization for R
text: cograph modern R package network visualization. renders publication-ready network plots adjacency matrices, edge lists, igraph, statnet network, qgraph, tna objects using pipe-friendly API full control nodes, edges, layouts, themes. Key features: Base R grid rendering via splot() soplot() Pipe-friendly API: cograph() |> sn_nodes() |> sn_edges() |> sn_theme() 25+ node shapes including pie charts donut rings 7 built-themes multiple color palettes Confidence interval underlays, edge label templates, weight scaling Converters tna qgraph objects

title: Modern Network Visualization for R
code: # Install from CRAN (when available) #install.packages("cograph")  # Or install the development version from GitHub # install.packages("devtools") #devtools::install_github("sonsoleslp/cograph") library(cograph)

title: Modern Network Visualization for R
text: cograph supports statistical edge visualization CI underlays significance notation.  Template placeholders: {est}, {low}, {}, {range}, {p}, stars
code: # 10-node directed transition matrix (TNA-style) set.seed(42) states <- c("Explore", "Plan", "Monitor", "Evaluate", "Adapt",             "Reflect", "Regulate", "Execute", "Collaborate", "Review") mat <- matrix(runif(100, 0, 0.3), nrow = 10, dimnames = list(states, states)) diag(mat) <- 0 mat <- mat / rowSums(mat)  # row-normalize # Publication-ready with CI underlays and labels splot(mat,   edge_ci = runif(sum(mat > 0), 0.05, 0.2), layout = "oval",   edge_label_template = "{est}{stars}",   edge_label_p = runif(sum(mat > 0), 0, 0.1),   edge_label_stars = TRUE, edge_label_bg = "transparent", edge_label_color = "maroon",    edge_label_size = 0.5, edge_label_position = 0.6 )

title: Modern Network Visualization for R
code: set.seed(1) # Each node gets a vector of pie segment values pie_vals <- lapply(1:10, function(i) runif(4)) pie_cols <- c("#E41A1C", "#377EB8", "#4DAF4A", "#FF7F00")  splot(mat,   node_shape = "pie",   pie_values = pie_vals,   pie_colors = pie_cols,  node_size = 10,   layout = "oval" )  # Per-node color palettes pie_cols_multi <- list(   c("#E63946", "#F1FAEE", "#A8DADC"),   c("#264653", "#2A9D8F", "#E9C46A"),   c("#F72585", "#7209B7", "#3A0CA3"),   c("#003049", "#D62828", "#F77F00"),   c("#606C38", "#283618", "#DDA15E"),   c("#0077B6", "#00B4D8", "#90E0EF"),   c("#9B2226", "#AE2012", "#BB3E03"),   c("#023047", "#219EBC", "#8ECAE6"),   c("#5F0F40", "#9A031E", "#FB8B24"),   c("#2D00F7", "#6A00F4", "#8900F2") ) splot(mat,   node_shape = "pie",   pie_values = lapply(1:10, function(i) runif(3)),   pie_colors = pie_cols_multi,   node_size = 10,   layout = "oval" )

title: Modern Network Visualization for R
code: fills <- runif(10, 0.3, 0.95)  # Per-node donut color palettes donut_cols_multi <- list(   c("#003049", "#D62828", "#F77F00", "#FCBF49"),   c("#606C38", "#283618", "#DDA15E", "#BC6C25"),   c("#0077B6", "#00B4D8", "#90E0EF", "#CAF0F8"),   c("#9B2226", "#AE2012", "#BB3E03", "#CA6702"),   c("#5F0F40", "#9A031E", "#FB8B24", "#E36414"),   c("#023047", "#219EBC", "#8ECAE6", "#FFB703"),   c("#264653", "#2A9D8F", "#E9C46A", "#F4A261"),   c("#F72585", "#B5179E", "#7209B7", "#560BAD"),   c("#10002B", "#240046", "#3C096C", "#5A189A"),   c("#D8F3DC", "#B7E4C7", "#95D5B2", "#74C69D") ) splot(mat,   donut_values = lapply(1:10, function(i) runif(4)),   donut_colors = donut_cols_multi,   donut_inner_ratio = 0.55,   node_size = 8 )  # Donut + Pie combo: outer donut ring with inner pie segments   splot(mat,   node_shape = "donut",   donut_fill = fills,   donut_shape = c("circle", "hexagon", "square", "diamond", "triangle",                   "pentagon", "circle", "hexagon", "square", "diamond"),   donut_color = palette_viridis(10) )

title: Modern Network Visualization for R
text: plot_htna() creates multi-group network layouts node groups arranged geometric patterns (bipartite, triangle, rectangle, polygon, circular).
code: layout(t(1:2)); par(mar=c(0,0,0,0)) # Create network with 3 groups set.seed(42) nodes <- paste0("N", 1:15) m <- matrix(runif(225, 0, 0.3), 15, 15) diag(m) <- 0 colnames(m) <- rownames(m) <- nodes  node_types <- list(   Teacher = paste0("N", 1:5),   Student = paste0("N", 6:10),   System = paste0("N", 11:15) )  # Polygon layout (triangle for 3 groups) plot_htna(m, node_types, layout = "polygon", minimum = 0.15)  # Circular layout (groups as arcs) plot_htna(m, node_types, layout = "circular", minimum = 0.15)

title: Modern Network Visualization for R
text: plot_mtna() visualizes multiple network clusters summary edges clusters individual edges within clusters. cluster displayed shape (circle, square, diamond, triangle) containing nodes.  Key parameters: * spacing: Distance cluster centers * shape_size: Size cluster shells * node_spacing: Node placement within shapes (0-1) * shapes: Vector shapes per cluster (“circle”, “square”, “diamond”, “triangle”) * summary_edges: Show aggregated -cluster edges (default TRUE) * within_edges: Show individual within-cluster edges (default TRUE) Alias: mtna() available shorthand plot_mtna().
code: par(mar=c(0,0,0,0)) # Create network with 6 clusters set.seed(42) nodes <- paste0("N", 1:30) m <- matrix(runif(900, 0, 0.3), 30, 30) diag(m) <- 0 colnames(m) <- rownames(m) <- nodes  clusters <- list(   Alpha = paste0("N", 1:5),   Beta = paste0("N", 6:10),   Gamma = paste0("N", 11:15),   Delta = paste0("N", 16:20),   Epsilon = paste0("N", 21:25),   Zeta = paste0("N", 26:30) )  # Summary edges between clusters + individual edges within plot_mtna(m, clusters)

title: Modern Network Visualization for R
text: plot_mlna() visualizes multilevel/multiplex networks multiple layers stacked 3D perspective view. layer contains nodes connected solid edges (within-layer), dashed lines connect nodes adjacent layers (inter-layer edges).
code: par(mar=c(0,0,0,0)) # Create multilevel network set.seed(42) nodes <- paste0("N", 1:21) m <- matrix(runif(441, 0, 0.3), 21, 21) diag(m) <- 0 colnames(m) <- rownames(m) <- nodes  # Define 3 layers layers <- list(   Macro = paste0("N", 1:7),   Meso = paste0("N", 8:14),   Micro = paste0("N", 15:21) )  # Basic usage with spring layout plot_mlna(m, layers, layout = "spring", minimum = 0.18, legend = FALSE)

text: Combines duplicate edges aggregating weights using specified function (sum, mean, max, min, first).

title: Aggregate Duplicate Edges — aggregate_duplicate_edges
text: edges Data frame , , weight columns. method Aggregation method: "sum" (default), "mean", "max", "min", "first", custom function takes numeric vector returns single value.

title: Aggregate Duplicate Edges — aggregate_duplicate_edges
text: deduplicated data frame columns input, node pair appears aggregated weight.

title: Aggregate Duplicate Edges — aggregate_duplicate_edges
text: sum Total weight duplicate edges. Useful frequency counts edges represent additive quantities (e.g., number emails). mean Average weight. Useful averaging multiple measurements duplicates represent repeated observations. max Maximum weight. Useful finding strongest connection recent value. min Minimum weight. Useful conservative estimate earliest value. first Keep first occurrence. Useful preserving original order duplicates erroneous. output edge list uses canonical node ordering (lower index first undirected networks), ensuring consistent /assignment.

title: Aggregate Duplicate Edges — aggregate_duplicate_edges
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create edges with duplicates edges <- data.frame(   from = c(1, 1, 2),   to = c(2, 2, 3),   weight = c(0.5, 0.3, 0.4) )  # Aggregate by sum (0.5 + 0.3 = 0.8) aggregate_duplicate_edges(edges, method = "sum") #   from to weight # 1    1  2    0.8 # 2    2  3    0.4  # Aggregate by mean (average: 0.4) aggregate_duplicate_edges(edges, method = "mean") #   from to weight # 1    1  2    0.4 # 2    2  3    0.4  # Use custom aggregation function aggregate_duplicate_edges(edges, method = function(x) sqrt(sum(x^2))) } # }

title: Convert to Cograph Network — as_cograph
text: x Network input. Can : square numeric matrix (adjacency/weight matrix) data frame edge list (, , optional weight columns) igraph object statnet network object qgraph object tna object existing cograph_network object (returned -) directed Logical. Force directed interpretation. NULL auto-detect. ... Additional arguments (currently unused).

title: Convert to Cograph Network — as_cograph
text: cograph_network object: named list components: Integer vector source node indices Integer vector target node indices weight Numeric vector edge weights nodes Data frame id, label, (x, y layout applied) directed Logical indicating network directed n_nodes Integer count nodes n_edges Integer count edges labels Character vector node labels source Character indicating input type layout Layout coordinates (NULL computed) layout_info Layout algorithm info (NULL computed)

title: Convert to Cograph Network — as_cograph
text: cograph_network format designed : Simple: data accessible via net$, net$, net$weight, etc. Modern: Uses named list elements instead attributes clean $ access Compatible: Works seamlessly splot() cograph functions Use getter functions programmatic access: get_nodes, get_edges, get_labels Use setter functions modify: set_nodes, set_edges, set_layout

title: Convert to Cograph Network — as_cograph
code: # From adjacency matrix mat <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0), nrow = 3) net <- as_cograph(mat)  # Direct $ access to all data net$from       # edge sources #> [1] 1 1 2 net$to         # edge targets #> [1] 2 3 3 net$weight     # edge weights #> [1] 1 1 1 net$nodes      # nodes data frame #>   id label name  x  y #> 1  1     1    1 NA NA #> 2  2     2    2 NA NA #> 3  3     3    3 NA NA net$directed   # TRUE/FALSE #> [1] FALSE net$n_nodes    # 3 #> [1] 3 net$n_edges    # 3 #> [1] 3  # Getter functions (recommended for programmatic use) get_nodes(net)   # nodes data frame #>   id label name  x  y #> 1  1     1    1 NA NA #> 2  2     2    2 NA NA #> 3  3     3    3 NA NA get_edges(net)   # edges data frame (from, to, weight) #>   from to weight #> 1    1  2      1 #> 2    1  3      1 #> 3    2  3      1 get_labels(net)  # character vector of labels #> [1] "1" "2" "3" n_nodes(net)     # 3 #> [1] 3 n_edges(net)     # 3 #> [1] 3 is_directed(net) # FALSE (symmetric matrix) #> [1] FALSE  # Setter functions net <- set_nodes(net, data.frame(id = 1:3, label = c("A", "B", "C"))) net <- set_edges(net, data.frame(from = c(1,2), to = c(2,3), weight = c(0.5, 0.8))) net <- set_layout(net, data.frame(x = c(0, 1, 0.5), y = c(0, 0, 1)))  # Plot it splot(net)   # From igraph (if installed) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(igraph) g <- make_ring(10) net <- as_cograph(g) splot(net) } # }

title: Create a Network Visualization — cograph
code: # From adjacency matrix adj <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0), nrow = 3) cograph(adj) #> Cograph Network #> ============== #> Nodes: 3  #> Edges: 3  #> Directed: FALSE  #> Weighted: FALSE  #> Layout: computed  #> Theme: classic  #>  #> Use plot() or sn_render() to visualize #> Use sn_ggplot() to convert to ggplot2  # From edge list edges <- data.frame(from = c(1, 1, 2), to = c(2, 3, 3)) cograph(edges) #> Cograph Network #> ============== #> Nodes: 3  #> Edges: 3  #> Directed: FALSE  #> Weighted: FALSE  #> Layout: computed  #> Theme: classic  #>  #> Use plot() or sn_render() to visualize #> Use sn_ggplot() to convert to ggplot2  # With customization (pipe-friendly workflow) adj <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0), nrow = 3) cograph(adj, layout = "circle") |>   sn_nodes(fill = "steelblue") |>   sn_edges(color = "gray50") |>   splot()   # Weighted network with automatic styling w_adj <- matrix(c(0, 0.5, -0.3, 0.5, 0, 0.4, -0.3, 0.4, 0), nrow = 3) cograph(w_adj) |>   sn_edges(color = "weight", width = "weight") |>   splot()   # With igraph (if installed) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(igraph) g <- make_ring(10) cograph(g) |> splot() } # }

title: Detect Duplicate Edges in Undirected Network — detect_duplicate_edges
text: list two components: has_duplicates Logical indicating whether duplicates found. info list duplicate details, element contains: nodes (node pair), count (number edges), weights (vector weights available).

title: Detect Duplicate Edges in Undirected Network — detect_duplicate_edges
text: function useful cleaning network data visualization. Duplicate edges can arise : Data collection errors (edge recorded twice) Combining multiple data sources Converting formats allow multi-edges Edge lists include ->B B->undirected networks function creates canonical keys sorting node pairs (lower index first), edges 1->2 2->1 map key "1-2" undirected mode.

title: Detect Duplicate Edges in Undirected Network — detect_duplicate_edges
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create edges with duplicates edges <- data.frame(   from = c(1, 1, 2, 2, 3),   to = c(2, 2, 3, 1, 1),   weight = c(0.5, 0.3, 0.4, 0.6, 0.2) )  # Detect duplicates (undirected: 1-2 appears 3 times, 1-3 appears 2 times) result <- detect_duplicate_edges(edges) result$has_duplicates # [1] TRUE  # View duplicate details result$info[[1]] # $nodes: 1, 2 # $count: 3 # $weights: 0.5, 0.3, 0.6 } # }

what: Convert a qgraph object to cograph parameters — from_qgraph
title: Convert a qgraph object to cograph parameters — from_qgraph

title: Convert a qgraph object to cograph parameters — from_qgraph
code: from_qgraph(   qgraph_object,   engine = c("splot", "soplot"),   plot = TRUE,   weight_digits = 2,   show_zero_edges = FALSE,   ... )

title: Convert a qgraph object to cograph parameters — from_qgraph
text: qgraph_object Return value qgraph::qgraph() engine cograph renderer use: "splot" "soplot". Default: "splot". plot Logical. TRUE (default), immediately plot using chosen engine. weight_digits Number decimal places round edge weights . Default 2. Edges round zero removed unless show_zero_edges = TRUE. show_zero_edges Logical. TRUE, keep edges even weight rounds zero. Default: FALSE. ... Override extracted parameter. Use qgraph-style names (e.g., minimum) cograph names (e.g., threshold).

title: Convert a qgraph object to cograph parameters — from_qgraph
text: Invisibly, named list cograph parameters can passed splot() soplot().

title: Convert a qgraph object to cograph parameters — from_qgraph
text: following qgraph parameters automatically extracted mapped cograph equivalents: Node properties: labels/names -> labels color -> node_fill width -> node_size (scaled 1.3x) shape -> node_shape (mapped cograph equivalents) border.color -> node_border_color border.width -> node_border_width label.cex -> label_size label.color -> label_color Edge properties: labels -> edge_labels label.cex -> edge_label_size (scaled 0.5x) lty -> edge_style (numeric name conversion) curve -> curvature asize -> arrow_size (scaled 0.3x) Graph properties: minimum -> threshold maximum -> maximum groups -> groups directed -> directed posCol/negCol -> edge_positive_color/edge_negative_color Pie/Donut: pie values -> donut_fill donut_inner_ratio=0.8 pieColor -> donut_color

title: Convert a qgraph object to cograph parameters — from_qgraph
text: edge_color edge_width extracted qgraph bakes cut-based fading vectors, producing near-invisible edges. cograph applies weight-based styling instead. cut parameter also passed causes faint edges hanging labels. Layout coordinates qgraph preserved rescale=FALSE. override layout, rescale automatically re-enabled.

title: Convert a qgraph object to cograph parameters — from_qgraph
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Convert and plot a qgraph object library(qgraph) adj <- matrix(c(0, .5, .3, .5, 0, .4, .3, .4, 0), 3, 3) q <- qgraph(adj) from_qgraph(q)  # Plots with splot  # Use soplot engine instead from_qgraph(q, engine = "soplot")  # Override extracted parameters from_qgraph(q, node_fill = "steelblue", layout = "circle")  # Extract parameters without plotting params <- from_qgraph(q, plot = FALSE) names(params)  # See what was extracted  # Works with themed qgraph objects q_themed <- qgraph(adj, theme = "colorblind", posCol = "blue") from_qgraph(q_themed) } # }

TRUE (default), immediately plot using chosen engine. weight_digits Number decimal places round edge weights . Default 2. title: Convert a tna object to cograph parameters — from_tna
text: Invisibly, named list cograph parameters can passed splot() soplot().

title: Convert a tna object to cograph parameters — from_tna
text: tna object's transition matrix becomes edge weights, labels become node labels, initial state probabilities (inits) mapped donut_fill values visualize starting state distributions. TNA networks always treated directed transition matrices represent directional state changes. default donut_inner_ratio 0.8 creates thin rings effectively visualize probability values without obscuring node labels.

title: Convert a tna object to cograph parameters — from_tna
text: following tna properties automatically extracted: weights: Transition matrix -> edge weights labels: State labels -> node labels inits: Initial probabilities -> donut_fill (0-1 scale)

title: Convert a tna object to cograph parameters — from_tna
text: following visual defaults applied TNA plots (can overridden via ...): layout = "oval": Oval/elliptical node arrangement node_fill: Colors TNA palette (Accent/Set3 based state count) node_size = 7: Larger nodes readability arrow_size = 0.61: Prominent directional arrows edge_color = "#003355": Dark blue edges edge_labels = TRUE: Show transition weights edges edge_label_size = 0.6: Readable edge labels edge_label_position = 0.7: Labels positioned toward target edge_start_style = "dotted": Dotted line edge source edge_start_length = 0.2: 20% edge dotted

title: Convert a tna object to cograph parameters — from_tna
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Convert and plot a tna object library(tna) trans <- tna(transitions) from_tna(trans)  # Plots with donut rings showing initial probabilities  # Use soplot engine instead from_tna(trans, engine = "soplot")  # Customize the visualization from_tna(trans, layout = "circle", donut_color = c("steelblue", "gray90"))  # Extract parameters without plotting params <- from_tna(trans, plot = FALSE) # Modify and plot manually params$node_fill <- "coral" do.call(splot, params) } # }

title: Gephi Fruchterman-Reingold Layout — layout_gephi_fr
text: layout direct port Gephi's ForceAtlas algorithm variant Fruchterman-Reingold. Key differences igraph's layout_with_fr: Uses Gephi's specific constants (SPEED_DIVISOR=800, AREA_MULTIPLICATOR=10000) Includes configurable gravity toward center Different cooling/speed mechanism

title: Group-based Layout — layout_groups
code: # Create a network with groups adj <- matrix(0, 9, 9) adj[1, 2:3] <- 1; adj[2:3, 1] <- 1  # Group 1 adj[4, 5:6] <- 1; adj[5:6, 4] <- 1  # Group 2 adj[7, 8:9] <- 1; adj[8:9, 7] <- 1  # Group 3 net <- CographNetwork$new(adj) groups <- c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3) coords <- layout_groups(net, groups)

title: Oval Layout — layout_oval
text: network CographNetwork object. ratio Aspect ratio (width/height). Values > 1 create horizontal ovals, values < 1 create vertical ovals. Default 1.5. order Optional vector specifying node order (indices labels). start_angle Starting angle radians (default: pi/2 top). clockwise Logical. Arrange nodes clockwise? Default TRUE. rotation Rotation angle radians tilt entire oval. Default 0.

title: Oval Layout — layout_oval
text: Data frame x, y coordinates.

title: Oval Layout — layout_oval
code: adj <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0), nrow = 3) net <- CographNetwork$new(adj) coords <- layout_oval(net, ratio = 1.5)

text: Plots TNA model nodes arranged multiple groups using geometric layouts: 2 groups: Bipartite (two vertical columns horizontal rows) 3+ groups: Polygon (nodes along edges regular polygon) Supports triangle (3), rectangle (4), pentagon (5), hexagon (6), beyond.

title: Plot Heterogeneous TNA Network (Multi-Group Layout) — plot_htna
code: plot_htna(   x,   node_list,   layout = "auto",   use_list_order = TRUE,   jitter = TRUE,   jitter_amount = 0.8,   jitter_side = "first",   orientation = "vertical",   group1_pos = -1.2,   group2_pos = 1.2,   curvature = 0.4,   group1_color = "#ffd89d",   group2_color = "#a68ba5",   group1_shape = "circle",   group2_shape = "square",   group_colors = NULL,   group_shapes = NULL,   angle_spacing = 0.15,   edge_colors = NULL,   legend = TRUE,   legend_position = "topright",   extend_lines = FALSE,   scale = 1,   ... )

title: Plot Heterogeneous TNA Network (Multi-Group Layout) — plot_htna
text: x tna object weight matrix. node_list List 2+ character vectors defining node groups. layout Layout type: "auto" (default), "bipartite", "polygon", "circular". "auto", uses bipartite 2 groups polygon 3+ groups. "circular" places groups along arcs circle. Legacy values "triangle" "rectangle" supported aliases "polygon". use_list_order Logical. Use node_list order (TRUE) weight-based order (FALSE). applies bipartite layout. jitter Controls horizontal spread nodes. Options: TRUE (default): Auto-compute jitter based edge connectivity FALSE 0: jitter (nodes aligned columns) Numeric (0-1): Amount jitter (0.3 = spread nodes 30\ Named list: Manual per-node offsets label (e.g., list(Wrong = -0.2)) Numeric vector length n: Direct x-offsets node applies bipartite layout. jitter_amount Base jitter amount jitter=TRUE. Default 0.5. Higher values spread nodes toward center. applies bipartite layout. jitter_side side(s) apply jitter: "first", "second", "", "none". Default "first" (first group nodes jittered toward center). applies bipartite layout. orientation Layout orientation bipartite: "vertical" (two columns, default) "horizontal" (two rows). Ignored triangle/rectangle layouts. group1_pos Position first group bipartite layout. Default -1.2. group2_pos Position second group bipartite layout. Default 1.2. curvature Edge curvature amount. Default 0.4 visible curves. group1_color Color first group nodes. Default "#ffd89d". group2_color Color second group nodes. Default "#a68ba5". group1_shape Shape first group nodes. Default "circle". group2_shape Shape second group nodes. Default "square". group_colors Vector colors group. Overrides group1_color/group2_color. Required 3+ groups using defaults. group_shapes Vector shapes group. Overrides group1_shape/group2_shape. Required 3+ groups using defaults. angle_spacing Controls empty space corners (0-1). Default 0.15. Higher values create larger empty angles vertices. applies triangle/rectangle layouts. edge_colors Vector colors edges source group. NULL (default), uses darker versions group_colors. Set FALSE use default edge color. legend Logical. Whether show legend. Default TRUE polygon layouts. legend_position Position legend: "topright", "topleft", "bottomright", "bottomleft", "right", "left", "top", "bottom". Default "topright". extend_lines Logical numeric. Draw extension lines nodes. applies bipartite layout. FALSE (default): extension lines TRUE: Draw lines extending toward group (default length 0.1) Numeric: Length extension lines ... Additional parameters passed tplot().

title: Plot Heterogeneous TNA Network (Multi-Group Layout) — plot_htna
text: Invisibly returns result tplot().

title: Plot Heterogeneous TNA Network (Multi-Group Layout) — plot_htna
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Define node groups (2 groups - bipartite) node_types <- list(   Student = c("Wrong", "Retry", "Right", "Attempt", "Instruction", "Skip"),   AI = c("Order", "Correct", "Hint", "Quit", "Clarify", "Question", "Praise") )  # Basic bipartite plot plot_htna(model, node_types)  # With custom jitter plot_htna(model, node_types, jitter_amount = 0.5)  # Triangle layout (3 groups) node_types_3 <- list(   Teacher = c("Explain", "Question", "Feedback"),   Student = c("Answer", "Ask", "Attempt"),   System = c("Hint", "Score", "Progress") ) plot_htna(model, node_types_3)  # Auto-detects triangle  # Rectangle layout (4 groups) node_types_4 <- list(   Input = c("Click", "Type", "Scroll"),   Process = c("Validate", "Transform"),   Output = c("Display", "Alert"),   Storage = c("Save", "Load", "Cache") ) plot_htna(model, node_types_4)  # Auto-detects rectangle  # Explicit layout selection plot_htna(model, node_types_3, layout = "triangle") } # }

title: Multilevel Network Visualization — plot_mlna
text: Visualizes multilevel/multiplex networks multiple layers stacked 3D perspective view. layer contains nodes connected solid edges (within-layer), dashed lines connect nodes adjacent layers (inter-layer edges). layer enclosed parallelogram shell giving pseudo-3D appearance.

title: Multilevel Network Visualization — plot_mlna
code: plot_mlna(   model,   layer_list,   layout = "horizontal",   layer_spacing = 2.2,   layer_width = 4.5,   layer_depth = 2.2,   skew_angle = 25,   node_spacing = 0.7,   colors = NULL,   shapes = NULL,   edge_colors = NULL,   within_edges = TRUE,   between_edges = TRUE,   between_style = 2,   show_border = TRUE,   legend = TRUE,   legend_position = "topright",   curvature = 0.15,   node_size = 3,   minimum = 0,   scale = 1,   ... )  mlna(   model,   layer_list,   layout = "horizontal",   layer_spacing = 2.2,   layer_width = 4.5,   layer_depth = 2.2,   skew_angle = 25,   node_spacing = 0.7,   colors = NULL,   shapes = NULL,   edge_colors = NULL,   within_edges = TRUE,   between_edges = TRUE,   between_style = 2,   show_border = TRUE,   legend = TRUE,   legend_position = "topright",   curvature = 0.15,   node_size = 3,   minimum = 0,   scale = 1,   ... )

title: Multilevel Network Visualization — plot_mlna
text: model tna object weight matrix. layer_list List character vectors defining layers. element contains node names belonging layer. Layers displayed top bottom list order. layout Node layout within layers: "horizontal" (default) spreads nodes horizontally, "circle" arranges nodes ellipse, "spring" uses force-directed placement based within-layer connections. layer_spacing Vertical distance layer centers. Default 2.2. layer_width Horizontal width layer shell. Default 4.5. layer_depth Depth layer (3D effect). Default 2.2. skew_angle Angle perspective skew degrees. Default 25. node_spacing Node placement ratio within layer (0-1). Default 0.7. Higher values spread nodes closer layer edges. colors Vector colors layer. Default auto-generated. shapes Vector shapes layer. Default cycles "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle". edge_colors Vector edge colors source layer. NULL (default), uses darker versions layer colors. within_edges Logical. Show edges within layers (solid lines). Default TRUE. between_edges Logical. Show edges adjacent layers (dashed lines). Default TRUE. between_style Line style -layer edges. Default 2 (dashed). Use 1 solid, 3 dotted. show_border Logical. Draw parallelogram shells around layers. Default TRUE. legend Logical. Whether show legend. Default TRUE. legend_position Position legend. Default "topright". curvature Edge curvature within-layer edges. Default 0.15. node_size Size nodes. Default 2.5. minimum Minimum edge weight threshold. Edges hidden. Default 0. ... Additional parameters (currently unused).

title: Multilevel Network Visualization — plot_mlna
text: Invisibly returns NULL.

title: Multilevel Network Visualization — plot_mlna
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create multilevel network set.seed(42) nodes <- paste0("N", 1:15) m <- matrix(runif(225, 0, 0.3), 15, 15) diag(m) <- 0 colnames(m) <- rownames(m) <- nodes  # Define 3 layers layers <- list(   Macro = paste0("N", 1:5),   Meso = paste0("N", 6:10),   Micro = paste0("N", 11:15) )  # Basic usage plot_mlna(m, layers)  # Customized plot_mlna(m, layers,      layer_spacing = 2.5,      layer_width = 5,      between_style = 2,  # dashed      minimum = 0.1)  # Circle layout within layers plot_mlna(m, layers, layout = "circle") } # }

code: plot_mtna(   x,   cluster_list,   layout = "circle",   spacing = 3,   shape_size = 1.2,   node_spacing = 0.5,   colors = NULL,   shapes = NULL,   edge_colors = NULL,   bundle_edges = TRUE,   bundle_strength = 0.8,   summary_edges = TRUE,   within_edges = TRUE,   show_border = TRUE,   legend = TRUE,   legend_position = "topright",   curvature = 0.3,   node_size = 2,   scale = 1,   ... )  mtna(   x,   cluster_list,   layout = "circle",   spacing = 3,   shape_size = 1.2,   node_spacing = 0.5,   colors = NULL,   shapes = NULL,   edge_colors = NULL,   bundle_edges = TRUE,   bundle_strength = 0.8,   summary_edges = TRUE,   within_edges = TRUE,   show_border = TRUE,   legend = TRUE,   legend_position = "topright",   curvature = 0.3,   node_size = 2,   scale = 1,   ... )

title: Multi-Cluster TNA Network Plot — plot_mtna
text: x tna object weight matrix. cluster_list List character vectors defining clusters. cluster becomes separate shape layout. layout arrange clusters: "circle" (default), "grid", "horizontal", "vertical". spacing Distance cluster centers. Default 3. shape_size Size cluster shape (shell radius). Default 1.2. node_spacing Radius node placement within shapes (0-1 relative shape_size). Default 0.5. colors Vector colors cluster. Default auto-generated. shapes Vector shapes cluster: "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle". Default cycles . edge_colors Vector edge colors source cluster. Default auto-generated. bundle_edges Logical. Bundle inter-cluster edges channels. Default TRUE. bundle_strength tightly bundle edges (0-1). Default 0.8. summary_edges Logical. Show aggregated summary edges clusters instead individual node edges. Default TRUE. within_edges Logical. summary_edges TRUE, also show individual edges within cluster. Default TRUE. show_border Logical. Draw border around cluster. Default TRUE. legend Logical. Whether show legend. Default TRUE. legend_position Position legend. Default "topright". curvature Edge curvature. Default 0.3. node_size Size nodes inside shapes. Default 2. ... Additional parameters passed plot_tna().

title: Multi-Cluster TNA Network Plot — plot_mtna
text: Invisibly returns NULL summary mode, plot_tna result.

title: Multi-Cluster TNA Network Plot — plot_mtna
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create network with 4 clusters nodes <- paste0("N", 1:20) m <- matrix(runif(400, 0, 0.3), 20, 20) diag(m) <- 0 colnames(m) <- rownames(m) <- nodes  clusters <- list(   North = paste0("N", 1:5),   East = paste0("N", 6:10),   South = paste0("N", 11:15),   West = paste0("N", 16:20) )  # Summary edges between clusters + individual edges within plot_mtna(m, clusters, summary_edges = TRUE)  # Control spacing and sizes plot_mtna(m, clusters, spacing = 4, shape_size = 1.5, node_spacing = 0.6) } # }

text: weights Numeric vector edge weights. esize Base edge size. NULL uses adaptive sizing based n_nodes. n_nodes Number nodes (adaptive esize calculation). directed Whether network directed (affects adaptive esize). mode Scaling mode: "linear", "log", "sqrt", "rank". maximum Max weight normalization. title: Scale Edge Widths Based on Weights — scale_edge_widths
text: linear (default): Direct proportional scaling, matches qgraph behavior. log: Logarithmic scaling wide weight ranges. Uses log1p stability. sqrt: Square root scaling moderate compression. rank: Rank-based scaling equal visual spacing regardless weight distribution.

title: Scale Edge Widths Based on Weights — scale_edge_widths
text: cut > 0, edges divided two tiers: cut: Minimal width variation (20% range) cut: Full width scaling (80% range) matches qgraph's behavior weak edges visually de-emphasized.

title: Scale Edge Widths Based on Weights — scale_edge_widths
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ weights <- c(0.1, 0.3, 0.5, 0.8, 1.0)  # Linear scaling (default) scale_edge_widths(weights, mode = "linear")  # Log scaling for wide ranges scale_edge_widths(c(0.01, 0.1, 1, 10, 100), mode = "log")  # With two-tier cut scale_edge_widths(weights, cut = 0.5)  # Rank-based (equal visual spacing) scale_edge_widths(weights, mode = "rank", cut = 0) } # }

code: sn_edges(   network,   width = NULL,   edge_size = NULL,   esize = NULL,   edge_width_range = NULL,   edge_scale_mode = NULL,   edge_cutoff = NULL,   cut = NULL,   color = NULL,   edge_positive_color = NULL,   positive_color = NULL,   edge_negative_color = NULL,   negative_color = NULL,   alpha = NULL,   style = NULL,   curvature = NULL,   arrow_size = NULL,   show_arrows = NULL,   maximum = NULL,   width_scale = NULL,   labels = NULL,   label_size = NULL,   label_color = NULL,   label_position = NULL,   label_offset = NULL,   label_bg = NULL,   label_bg_padding = NULL,   label_fontface = NULL,   label_border = NULL,   label_border_color = NULL,   label_underline = NULL,   label_shadow = NULL,   label_shadow_color = NULL,   label_shadow_offset = NULL,   label_shadow_alpha = NULL,   bidirectional = NULL,   loop_rotation = NULL,   curve_shape = NULL,   curve_pivot = NULL,   curves = NULL,   ci = NULL,   ci_scale = NULL,   ci_alpha = NULL,   ci_color = NULL,   ci_style = NULL,   ci_arrows = NULL,   ci_lower = NULL,   ci_upper = NULL,   label_style = NULL,   label_template = NULL,   label_digits = NULL,   label_ci_format = NULL,   label_p = NULL,   label_p_digits = NULL,   label_p_prefix = NULL,   label_stars = NULL )

title: Set Edge Aesthetics — sn_edges
text: network cograph_network object, matrix, data.frame, igraph object. Matrices inputs auto-converted. width Edge width. Can single value, vector (per-edge), "weight". edge_size Base edge size weight scaling. NULL (default) uses adaptive sizing based network size: 15 * exp(-n_nodes/90) + 1. Larger values = thicker edges. esize Deprecated. Use edge_size instead. edge_width_range Output width range c(min, max) weight-based scaling. Default c(0.5, 4). Edges scaled fit within range. edge_scale_mode Scaling mode edge weights: "linear" (default), "log" (wide weight ranges), "sqrt" (moderate compression), "rank" (equal visual spacing). edge_cutoff Two-tier cutoff edge width scaling. NULL (default) = auto 75th percentile. 0 = disabled. Positive number = manual threshold. cut Deprecated. Use edge_cutoff instead. color Edge color. Can single color, vector, "weight" automatic coloring based edge weights. edge_positive_color Color positive edge weights. positive_color Deprecated. Use edge_positive_color instead. edge_negative_color Color negative edge weights. negative_color Deprecated. Use edge_negative_color instead. alpha Edge transparency (0-1). style Line style: "solid", "dashed", "dotted", "longdash", "twodash". curvature Edge curvature amount (0 = straight). arrow_size Size arrow heads directed networks. show_arrows Logical. Show arrows? Default TRUE directed networks. maximum Maximum edge weight scaling width. Weights capped. Similar qgraph's maximum parameter. width_scale Scale factor edge widths. Values > 1 make edges thicker, values < 1 make thinner. Applied width calculations. labels Edge labels. Can TRUE (show weights), vector, column name. label_size Edge label text size. label_color Edge label text color. label_position Position along edge (0 = source, 0.5 = middle, 1 = target). label_offset Perpendicular offset edge line. label_bg Background color edge labels (default "white"). Set NA transparent. label_bg_padding Padding around label text proportion text size (default 0.3). label_fontface Font face: "plain", "bold", "italic", "bold.italic" (default "plain"). label_border Border style: NULL (none), "rect", "rounded", "circle" (default NULL). label_border_color Border color label border (default "gray50"). label_underline Logical. Underline label text? (default FALSE). label_shadow Logical. Enable drop shadow labels? (default FALSE). label_shadow_color Color label shadow (default "gray40"). label_shadow_offset Offset distance shadow points (default 0.5). label_shadow_alpha Transparency shadow (0-1, default 0.5). bidirectional Logical. Show arrows ends edges? loop_rotation Angle radians self-loop direction (default: pi/2 = top). curve_shape Spline tension curved edges (-1 1, default: 0). curve_pivot Pivot position along edge curve control point (0-1, default: 0.5). curves Curve mode: FALSE (straight edges), "mutual" (curve reciprocal pairs), "force" (curve edges). Default FALSE. ci Numeric vector CI widths (0-1 scale). Larger values = uncertainty. ci_scale Width multiplier CI underlay thickness. Default 2. ci_alpha Transparency CI underlay (0-1). Default 0.15. ci_color CI underlay color. NA (default) uses main edge color. ci_style Line type CI underlay: 1=solid, 2=dashed, 3=dotted. Default 2. ci_arrows Logical: show arrows CI underlay? Default FALSE. ci_lower Numeric vector lower CI bounds labels. ci_upper Numeric vector upper CI bounds labels. label_style Preset style: "none", "estimate", "full", "range", "stars". label_template Template placeholders: {est}, {range}, {low}, {}, {p}, {stars}. label_digits Decimal places estimates template. Default 2. label_ci_format CI format: "bracket" [low, ] "dash" low-. label_p Numeric vector p-values edges. label_p_digits Decimal places p-values. Default 3. label_p_prefix Prefix p-values. Default "p=". label_stars Stars labels: character vector, TRUE (compute p), numeric (treated p-values).

title: Set Edge Aesthetics — sn_edges
text: Modified cograph_network object can piped customization functions plotting functions.

title: Set Edge Aesthetics — sn_edges
text: aesthetic parameters can specified : Single value: Applied edges Vector: Per-edge values (must match edge count) "weight": Special value width color auto-maps edge weights

title: Set Edge Aesthetics — sn_edges
text: color = "weight", edges colored sign: Positive weights use edge_positive_color (default: green) Negative weights use edge_negative_color (default: red) width = "weight", edge widths scale absolute weight values, respecting maximum parameter set.

title: Set Edge Aesthetics — sn_edges
text: statistical output (e.g., regression coefficients CIs), use templates: label_template = "\{est\}": Show estimate label_template = "\{est\} [\{low\}, \{\}]": Estimate CI label_template = "\{est\}\{stars\}": Estimate significance Preset styles via label_style: "estimate": Weight/estimate "full": Estimate + CI brackets "range": CI range "stars": Significance stars

title: Set Edge Aesthetics — sn_edges
text: Visualize uncertainty drawing wider, semi-transparent edge behind: ci: Vector CI widths (0-1 scale) ci_scale: Width multiplier (default 2) ci_alpha: Transparency (default 0.15)

title: Set Edge Aesthetics — sn_edges
code: adj <- matrix(c(0, 1, -0.5, 1, 0, 1, -0.5, 1, 0), nrow = 3)  # Basic: auto-style by weight cograph(adj) |>   sn_edges(width = "weight", color = "weight") #> Cograph Network #> ============== #> Nodes: 3  #> Edges: 3  #> Directed: FALSE  #> Weighted: TRUE  #> Layout: computed  #> Theme: classic  #>  #> Use plot() or sn_render() to visualize #> Use sn_ggplot() to convert to ggplot2  # Direct matrix input (auto-converted) adj |> sn_edges(width = 2, color = "gray50") #> Cograph Network #> ============== #> Nodes: 3  #> Edges: 3  #> Directed: FALSE  #> Weighted: TRUE  #> Layout: computed  #> Theme: classic  #>  #> Use plot() or sn_render() to visualize #> Use sn_ggplot() to convert to ggplot2  # Custom positive/negative colors cograph(adj) |>   sn_edges(     color = "weight",     edge_positive_color = "darkblue",     edge_negative_color = "darkred"   ) |>   splot()   # Edge labels showing weights cograph(adj) |>   sn_edges(labels = TRUE, label_size = 0.8) |>   splot()  # Statistical output with CI template # Suppose we have estimates, lower/upper CI bounds estimates <- c(0.5, -0.3, 0.8) ci_lo <- c(0.2, -0.6, 0.5) ci_hi <- c(0.8, -0.1, 1.1)  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ cograph(adj) |>   sn_edges(     label_template = "{est} [{low}, {up}]",     ci_lower = ci_lo,     ci_upper = ci_hi,     label_digits = 2   ) |>   splot() } # }  # Curved edges for reciprocal pairs cograph(adj) |>   sn_edges(curves = "mutual", curvature = 0.3) |>   splot()

title: Apply Layout to Network — sn_layout
text: Modified cograph_network object.

title: Apply Layout to Network — sn_layout
text: spring Force-directed layout (Fruchterman-Reingold style). Good general-purpose layout. Default. circle Nodes arranged circle. Good small networks structure less important. groups Circular layout grouped nodes clustered together. grid Nodes regular grid. random Random positions. Useful starting point. star Central node others arranged around . bipartite Two-column layout bipartite networks.

title: Apply Layout to Network — sn_layout
text: Two-letter codes igraph layouts: "kk" (Kamada-Kawai), "fr" (Fruchterman-Reingold), "drl", "mds", "ni" (nicely), "tr" (tree), "ci" (circle), etc. can also pass igraph layout functions directly use full names like "layout_with_kk".

title: Apply Layout to Network — sn_layout
code: adj <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0), nrow = 3)  # Built-in layouts cograph(adj) |> sn_layout("circle") |> splot()  cograph(adj) |> sn_layout("spring") |> splot()   # igraph layouts (if igraph installed) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ cograph(adj) |> sn_layout("kk") |> splot() cograph(adj) |> sn_layout("fr") |> splot() } # }  # Custom coordinates coords <- matrix(c(0, 0, 1, 0, 0.5, 1), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE) cograph(adj) |> sn_layout(coords) |> splot()   # Direct matrix input (auto-converts) adj |> sn_layout("circle") #> Cograph Network #> ============== #> Nodes: 3  #> Edges: 3  #> Directed: FALSE  #> Weighted: FALSE  #> Layout: computed  #> Theme: classic  #>  #> Use plot() or sn_render() to visualize #> Use sn_ggplot() to convert to ggplot2

text: network cograph_network object, matrix, data.frame, igraph object. Matrices inputs auto-converted. size Node size. Can single value, vector (per-node), column name. shape Node shape. Options: "circle", "square", "triangle", "diamond", "pentagon", "hexagon", "ellipse", "heart", "star", "pie", "donut", "cross", "rectangle", custom SVG shape registered register_svg_shape(). node_svg Custom SVG node shape: path SVG file inline SVG string. Overrides shape parameter provided. svg_preserve_aspect Logical: maintain SVG aspect ratio? Default TRUE. fill Node fill color. Can single color, vector, column name. border_color Node border color. border_width Node border width. alpha Node transparency (0-1). label_size Label text size. label_color Label text color. label_position Label position: "center", "", "", "left", "right". show_labels Logical. Show node labels? Default TRUE. pie_values pie shape: list matrix values pie segments. element corresponds node contains values segments. pie_colors pie shape: colors pie segments. pie_border_width Border width pie chart nodes. donut_fill donut shape: numeric value (0-1) specifying fill proportion. 0.1 = 10% filled, 0.5 = 50% filled, 1.0 = fully filled ring. Can single value (nodes) vector (per-node values). donut_values Deprecated. Use donut_fill simple fill proportion. Still works backwards compatibility. donut_color donut shape: fill color(s) donut ring. Single color sets fill nodes. Two colors set fill background nodes. 2 colors set per-node fill colors (recycled n_nodes). Default: "lightgray" fill, "gray90" background shape="donut". donut_colors Deprecated. Use donut_color instead. donut_border_width Border width donut chart nodes. donut_inner_ratio donut shape: inner radius ratio (0-1). Default 0.5. donut_bg_color donut shape: background color unfilled portion. donut_shape donut: base shape ring ("circle", "square", "hexagon", "triangle", "diamond", "pentagon"). Default "circle". donut_show_value donut shape: show value center? Default FALSE. donut_value_size donut shape: font size center value. donut_value_color donut shape: color center value text. donut_value_fontface donut shape: font face center value ("plain", "bold", "italic", "bold.italic"). Default "bold". donut_value_fontfamily donut shape: font family center value ("sans", "serif", "mono"). Default "sans". donut_value_digits donut shape: decimal places value display. Default 2. donut_value_prefix donut shape: text value (e.g., "$"). Default "". donut_value_suffix donut shape: text value (e.g., "%"). Default "". donut_value_format donut shape: custom format function (overrides digits). donut2_values double donut: list values inner donut ring. donut2_colors double donut: colors inner donut ring segments. donut2_inner_ratio double donut: inner radius ratio inner donut ring. Default 0.4. label_fontface Font face node labels: "plain", "bold", "italic", "bold.italic". Default "plain". label_fontfamily Font family node labels: "sans", "serif", "mono", system font. Default "sans". label_hjust Horizontal justification node labels (0=left, 0.5=center, 1=right). Default 0.5. label_vjust Vertical justification node labels (0=bottom, 0.5=center, 1=top). Default 0.5. label_angle Text rotation angle degrees node labels. Default 0. node_names Alternative names legend (separate display labels).

title: Set Node Aesthetics — sn_nodes
code: adj <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0), nrow = 3)  # Basic usage with cograph() cograph(adj) |>   sn_nodes(size = 0.08, fill = "steelblue", shape = "circle") #> Cograph Network #> ============== #> Nodes: 3  #> Edges: 3  #> Directed: FALSE  #> Weighted: FALSE  #> Layout: computed  #> Theme: classic  #>  #> Use plot() or sn_render() to visualize #> Use sn_ggplot() to convert to ggplot2  # Direct matrix input (auto-converted) adj |> sn_nodes(fill = "coral", size = 0.1) #> Cograph Network #> ============== #> Nodes: 3  #> Edges: 3  #> Directed: FALSE  #> Weighted: FALSE  #> Layout: computed  #> Theme: classic  #>  #> Use plot() or sn_render() to visualize #> Use sn_ggplot() to convert to ggplot2  # Per-node customization with vectors cograph(adj) |>   sn_nodes(     size = c(0.08, 0.06, 0.1),     fill = c("red", "blue", "green"),     label_position = c("above", "below", "center")   ) |>   splot()   # Donut chart nodes showing proportions cograph(adj) |>   sn_nodes(     donut_fill = c(0.25, 0.75, 0.5),     donut_color = "steelblue",     donut_show_value = TRUE,     donut_value_suffix = "%"   ) |>   splot()  # Mixed shapes per node cograph(adj) |>   sn_nodes(     shape = c("circle", "square", "triangle"),     fill = c("#E41A1C", "#377EB8", "#4DAF4A")   ) |>   splot()

code: adj <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0), nrow = 3)  # Apply palette to nodes cograph(adj) |> sn_palette("viridis") |> splot()   # Apply to edges cograph(adj) |> sn_palette("colorblind", target = "edges") |> splot()  # Apply to both cograph(adj) |> sn_palette("pastel", target = "both") |> splot()  # Custom palette function my_pal <- function(n) rainbow(n, s = 0.7) cograph(adj) |> sn_palette(my_pal) |> splot()  # Direct matrix input adj |> sn_palette("viridis") #> Cograph Network #> ============== #> Nodes: 3  #> Edges: 3  #> Directed: FALSE  #> Weighted: FALSE  #> Layout: computed  #> Theme: classic  #>  #> Use plot() or sn_render() to visualize #> Use sn_ggplot() to convert to ggplot2

title: Plot Cograph Network — soplot
text: network cograph_network object, matrix, data.frame, igraph object. Matrices inputs auto-converted. title Optional plot title. title_size Title font size. margins Plot margins c(bottom, left, top, right). layout_margin Margin around network layout (proportion viewport). Default 0.15. newpage Logical. Start new graphics page? Default TRUE. layout Layout algorithm. Built-: "circle", "spring", "groups", "grid", "random", "star", "bipartite". igraph (2-letter): "kk" (Kamada-Kawai), "fr" (Fruchterman-Reingold), "drl", "mds", "ni" (nicely), "tr" (tree), etc. Can also pass coordinate matrix igraph layout function directly. theme Theme name: "classic", "dark", "minimal", etc. seed Random seed deterministic layouts. Default 42. Set NULL random. labels Node labels. Can character vector set custom labels. threshold Minimum absolute edge weight display. Edges abs(weight) < threshold hidden. Similar qgraph's threshold. maximum Maximum edge weight width scaling. Weights capped. Similar qgraph's maximum parameter. node_size Node size. node_shape Node shape: "circle", "square", "triangle", "diamond", "ellipse", "heart", "star", "pie", "donut", "cross". node_fill Node fill color. node_border_color Node border color. node_border_width Node border width. node_alpha Node transparency (0-1). label_size Node label text size. label_color Node label text color. label_position Label position: "center", "", "", "left", "right". show_labels Logical. Show node labels? pie_values pie/donut/donut_pie nodes: list matrix values segments. donut single value (0-1), shows proportion filled. pie_colors pie/donut/donut_pie nodes: colors pie segments. pie_border_width Border width pie chart segments. donut_values donut_pie nodes: vector values (0-1) outer ring proportion. donut_border_width Border width donut ring. donut_inner_ratio donut nodes: inner radius ratio (0-1). Default 0.5. donut_bg_color donut nodes: background color unfilled portion. donut_show_value donut nodes: show value center? Default FALSE. donut_value_size donut nodes: font size center value. donut_value_color donut nodes: color center value text. donut_fill Numeric value (0-1) donut fill proportion. simplified API creating donut charts. Can single value vector per node. donut_color Fill color(s) donut ring. Simplified API: single color fill, c(fill, background) . donut_colors Deprecated. Use donut_color instead. donut_shape Base shape donut: "circle", "square", "hexagon", "triangle", "diamond", "pentagon". Default inherits node_shape. donut_value_fontface Font face donut center value: "plain", "bold", "italic", "bold.italic". Default "bold". donut_value_fontfamily Font family donut center value. Default "sans". donut_value_digits Decimal places donut center value. Default 2. donut_value_prefix Text donut center value (e.g., "$"). Default "". donut_value_suffix Text donut center value (e.g., "%"). Default "". donut2_values List values inner donut ring (double donut). donut2_colors List color vectors inner donut ring segments. donut2_inner_ratio Inner radius ratio inner donut ring. Default 0.4. edge_width Edge width. NULL, scales weight using edge_size edge_width_range. edge_size Base edge size weight scaling. NULL (default) uses adaptive sizing based network size: 15 * exp(-n_nodes/90) + 1. Larger values = thicker edges. esize Deprecated. Use edge_size instead. edge_width_range Output width range c(min, max) weight-based scaling. Default c(0.5, 4). Edges scaled fit within range. edge_scale_mode Scaling mode edge weights: "linear" (default), "log" (wide weight ranges), "sqrt" (moderate compression), "rank" (equal visual spacing). edge_cutoff Two-tier cutoff edge width scaling. NULL (default) = auto 75th percentile. 0 = disabled. Positive number = manual threshold. cut Deprecated. Use edge_cutoff instead. edge_width_scale Scale factor edge widths. Values > 1 make edges thicker. edge_color Edge color. edge_alpha Edge transparency (0-1). edge_style Line style: "solid", "dashed", "dotted". curvature Edge curvature amount. arrow_size Size arrow heads. show_arrows Logical. Show arrows? edge_positive_color Color positive edge weights. positive_color Deprecated. Use edge_positive_color instead. edge_negative_color Color negative edge weights. negative_color Deprecated. Use edge_negative_color instead. edge_duplicates handle duplicate edges undirected networks. NULL (default) = stop error listing duplicates. Options: "sum", "mean", "first", "max", "min", custom aggregation function. edge_labels Edge labels. Can TRUE show weights, vector. edge_label_size Edge label text size. edge_label_color Edge label text color. edge_label_position Position along edge (0 = source, 0.5 = middle, 1 = target). edge_label_offset Perpendicular offset edge line. edge_label_bg Background color edge labels (default "white"). Set NA transparent. edge_label_fontface Font face: "plain", "bold", "italic", "bold.italic". edge_label_border Border style: NULL, "rect", "rounded", "circle". edge_label_border_color Border color label border. edge_label_underline Logical. Underline label text? bidirectional Logical. Show arrows ends edges? loop_rotation Angle radians self-loop direction (default: pi/2 = top). curve_shape Spline tension curved edges (-1 1, default: 0). curve_pivot Pivot position along edge curve control point (0-1, default: 0.5). curves Curve mode: TRUE (default) = single edges straight, reciprocal edges curve ellipse (two opposing curves); FALSE = straight; "force" = curved. node_names Alternative names legend (separate display labels). legend Logical. Show legend? legend_position Legend position: "topright", "topleft", "bottomright", "bottomleft". scaling Scaling mode: "default" qgraph-matched scaling node_size=6 looks similar qgraph vsize=6, "legacy" preserve pre-v2.0 behavior. weight_digits Number decimal places round edge weights plotting. Edges round zero automatically removed. Default 2. Set NULL disable rounding.

title: Plot Cograph Network — soplot
text: Invisible NULL. Called side effect drawing.

title: Plot Cograph Network — soplot
text: soplot() uses grid graphics splot() uses base R graphics. accept parameters produce visually similar output. Choose based : soplot: Better integration ggplot2, combining plots, publication-quality vector graphics. splot: Better large networks (faster rendering), interactive exploration, traditional R workflows.

title: Plot Cograph Network — soplot
text: Edge curving controlled curves curvature parameters: curves = FALSE edges straight lines. curves = TRUE (Default) Reciprocal edge pairs (->B B->) curve opposite directions form visual ellipse. Single edges remain straight. curves = "force" edges curve inward toward network center.

title: Plot Cograph Network — soplot
text: Controls edge weights map visual widths: linear Width proportional weight. Best similar-magnitude weights. log Logarithmic scaling. Best weights spanning orders magnitude. sqrt Square root scaling. Moderate compression skewed data. rank Rank-based scaling. Equal visual spacing regardless values.

title: Plot Cograph Network — soplot
text: donut system visualizes proportions (0-1) filled rings around nodes: donut_fill Proportion filled (0-1). Can scalar per-node vector. donut_color Fill color. Single color, c(fill, bg), per-node vector. donut_shape Base shape: "circle", "square", "hexagon", etc. donut_show_value Show numeric value center.

title: Plot Cograph Network — soplot
code: adj <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0), nrow = 3) # With cograph() cograph(adj) |> soplot()   # Direct matrix input with all options adj |> soplot(   layout = "circle",   node_fill = "steelblue",   node_size = 0.08,   edge_width = 2 )

title: Base R Graphics Network Plotting — splot
text: x Network input. Can : square numeric matrix (adjacency/weight matrix) data frame edge list (, , optional weight columns) igraph object cograph_network object layout Layout algorithm: "circle", "spring", "groups", matrix x,y coordinates, igraph layout function. Also supports igraph two-letter codes: "kk", "fr", "drl", "mds", "ni", etc. Default "oval" directed Logical. Force directed interpretation. NULL auto-detect. seed Random seed deterministic layouts. Default 42. theme Theme name: "classic", "dark", "minimal", "colorblind", etc. node_size Node size(s). Single value vector. Default 3. node_size2 Secondary node size ellipse/rectangle height. node_shape Node shape(s): "circle", "square", "triangle", "diamond", "pentagon", "hexagon", "star", "heart", "ellipse", "cross", custom SVG shape registered register_svg_shape(). node_svg Custom SVG nodes: path SVG file inline SVG string. svg_preserve_aspect Logical: maintain SVG aspect ratio? Default TRUE. node_fill Node fill color(s). node_border_color Node border color(s). node_border_width Node border width(s). node_alpha Node transparency (0-1). Default 1. labels Node labels: TRUE (use node names/indices), FALSE (none), character vector. label_size Label character expansion factor. label_color Label text color. label_position Label position: "center", "", "", "left", "right". label_fontface Font face labels: "plain", "bold", "italic", "bold.italic". Default "plain". label_fontfamily Font family labels: "sans", "serif", "mono". Default "sans". label_hjust Horizontal justification (0=left, 0.5=center, 1=right). Default 0.5. label_vjust Vertical justification (0=bottom, 0.5=center, 1=top). Default 0.5. label_angle Text rotation angle degrees. Default 0. pie_values List numeric vectors pie chart nodes. element corresponds node contains values pie segments. simple numeric vector values 0 1 provided (e.g., centrality scores), automatically converted donut_fill convenience. pie_colors List color vectors pie segments. pie_border_width Border width pie slice dividers. NULL uses node_border_width. donut_fill Numeric value (0-1) donut fill proportion. qgraph-style API: 0.1 = 10% filled, 0.5 = 50% filled, 1.0 = fully filled. Can single value (nodes) vector (per-node values). donut_values Deprecated. Use donut_fill simple fill proportion. donut_color Fill color(s) donut ring. Single color sets fill nodes. Two colors set fill background nodes. 2 colors set per-node fill colors (recycled n_nodes). Default: "maroon" fill, "gray90" background node_shape="donut". donut_colors Deprecated. Use donut_color instead. donut_border_color Border color donut rings. NULL uses node_border_color. donut_border_width Border width donut rings. NULL uses node_border_width. donut_outer_border_color Color outer boundary border (enables double border). NULL (default) shows single border. Set color double border effect. Can scalar per-node vector. donut_line_type Line type donut borders: "solid", "dashed", "dotted", numeric (1=solid, 2=dashed, 3=dotted). Can scalar per-node vector. donut_border_lty Deprecated. Use donut_line_type instead. donut_inner_ratio Inner radius ratio donut (0-1). Default 0.5. donut_bg_color Background color unfilled donut portion. donut_shape Base shape donut: "circle", "square", "hexagon", "triangle", "diamond", "pentagon". Can single value per-node vector. Default inherits node_shape (e.g., hexagon nodes get hexagon donuts). Set explicitly override (e.g., donut_shape = "hexagon" hexagon donuts nodes regardless node_shape). donut_show_value Logical: show value donut center? Default FALSE. donut_value_size Font size donut center value. donut_value_color Color donut center value. donut_value_fontface Font face donut center value: "plain", "bold", "italic", "bold.italic". Default "bold". donut_value_fontfamily Font family donut center value: "sans", "serif", "mono". Default "sans". donut_value_digits Decimal places donut center value. Default 2. donut_value_prefix Text donut center value (e.g., "$"). Default "". donut_value_suffix Text donut center value (e.g., "%"). Default "". donut_empty Logical: render empty donut rings NA values? Default TRUE. donut2_values List values inner donut ring (double donut). donut2_colors List color vectors inner donut ring segments. donut2_inner_ratio Inner radius ratio inner donut ring. Default 0.4. edge_color Edge color(s). NULL, uses edge_positive_color/edge_negative_color based weight. edge_width Edge width(s). NULL, scales weight using edge_size edge_width_range. edge_size Base edge size weight scaling. NULL (default) uses adaptive sizing based network size: 15 * exp(-n_nodes/90) + 1. directed networks, halved. Larger values = thicker edges overall. esize Deprecated. Use edge_size instead. edge_width_range Output width range c(min, max) weight-based scaling. Default c(0.5, 4). Edges scaled fit within range. edge_scale_mode Scaling mode edge weights: "linear" (default, qgraph-style), "log" (logarithmic wide weight ranges), "sqrt" (moderate compression), "rank" (equal visual spacing regardless weight distribution). edge_cutoff Two-tier cutoff edge width scaling. NULL (default) = auto-calculate 75th percentile weights (qgraph behavior). 0 = disabled (continuous scaling). Positive number = manual threshold. Edges cutoff get minimal width variation. cut Deprecated. Use edge_cutoff instead. edge_alpha Edge transparency (0-1). Default 0.8. edge_labels Edge labels: TRUE (show weights), FALSE (none), character vector. edge_label_size Edge label size. edge_label_color Edge label text color. edge_label_bg Edge label background color. edge_label_position Position along edge (0-1). edge_label_offset Perpendicular offset edge labels (0 = line, positive = ). edge_label_fontface Font face: "plain", "bold", "italic", "bold.italic". edge_label_shadow Logical: enable drop shadow edge labels? Default FALSE. edge_label_shadow_color Color edge label shadow. Default "gray40". edge_label_shadow_offset Offset distance shadow points. Default 0.5. edge_label_shadow_alpha Transparency shadow (0-1). Default 0.5. edge_style Line type(s): 1=solid, 2=dashed, 3=dotted, etc. curvature Edge curvature. 0 straight, positive/negative curves. curve_scale Logical: auto-curve reciprocal edges? curve_shape Spline tension (-1 1). Default 0. curve_pivot Position along edge curve control point (0-1). curves Curve mode: TRUE (default) = single edges straight, reciprocal edges curve ellipse (two opposing curves); FALSE = straight; "force" = curved. arrow_size Arrow head size. arrow_angle Arrow head angle radians. Default pi/6 (30 degrees). show_arrows Logical vector: show arrows directed edges? bidirectional Logical vector: show arrows ends? loop_rotation Angle(s) radians self-loop direction. edge_start_style Style start segment edges: "solid" (default), "dashed", "dotted". Use dashed/dotted indicate edge direction (source node). edge_start_length Fraction edge length styled start segment (0-0.5). Default 0.15 (15% edge). applies edge_start_style "solid". edge_start_dot_density Pattern dotted start segments. two-character string first digit dot length second gap length (line width units). Default "12" (1 unit dot, 2 units gap). Use "11" tighter dots, "13" spacing. applies edge_start_style = "dotted". edge_ci Numeric vector CI widths (0-1 scale). Larger values = uncertainty. edge_ci_scale Width multiplier underlay thickness. Default 2. edge_ci_alpha Transparency underlay (0-1). Default 0.15. edge_ci_color Underlay color. NA (default) uses main edge color. edge_ci_style Line type underlay: 1=solid, 2=dashed, 3=dotted. Default 2. edge_ci_arrows Logical: show arrows underlay? Default FALSE. edge_label_style Preset style: "none", "estimate", "full", "range", "stars". edge_label_template Template placeholders: {est}, {range}, {low}, {}, {p}, {stars}. Overrides edge_label_style provided. edge_label_digits Decimal places estimates. Default 2. edge_label_oneline Logical: single line format? Default TRUE. edge_label_ci_format CI format: "bracket" [low, ] "dash" low-. edge_ci_lower Numeric vector lower CI bounds labels. edge_ci_upper Numeric vector upper CI bounds labels. edge_label_p Numeric vector p-values edges. edge_label_p_digits Decimal places p-values. Default 3. edge_label_p_prefix Prefix p-values. Default "p=". edge_label_stars Stars labels: character vector, TRUE (compute p), numeric (treated p-values). weight_digits Number decimal places round edge weights plotting. Edges round zero automatically removed. Default 2. Set NULL disable rounding. threshold Minimum absolute weight display. minimum Alias threshold (qgraph compatibility). Uses max threshold minimum. maximum Maximum weight scaling. NULL auto. edge_positive_color Color positive weights. positive_color Deprecated. Use edge_positive_color instead. edge_negative_color Color negative weights. negative_color Deprecated. Use edge_negative_color instead. edge_duplicates handle duplicate edges undirected networks. NULL (default) = stop error listing duplicates. Options: "sum", "mean", "first", "max", "min", custom aggregation function. title Plot title. title_size Title font size. margins Margins c(bottom, left, top, right). background Background color. rescale Logical: rescale layout -1 1 range? layout_scale Scale factor layout. >1 expands (spreads nodes apart), <1 contracts (brings nodes closer). Use "auto" automatically scale based node count (compact small networks, expanded large). Default 1. layout_margin Margin around layout fraction range. Default 0.15. Set 0 extra margin (tighter fit). Affects white space around nodes. aspect Logical: maintain aspect ratio? use_pch Logical: use points() simple circles (faster). Default FALSE. usePCH Deprecated. Use use_pch instead. scaling Scaling mode: "default" qgraph-matched scaling node_size=6 looks similar qgraph vsize=6, "legacy" preserve pre-v2.0 behavior. legend Logical: show legend? legend_position Position: "topright", "topleft", "bottomright", "bottomleft". legend_size Legend text size. legend_edge_colors Logical: show positive/negative edge colors legend? legend_node_sizes Logical: show node size scale legend? groups Group assignments node coloring/legend. node_names Alternative names legend (separate labels). filetype Output format: "default" (screen), "png", "pdf", "svg", "jpeg", "tiff". filename Output filename (without extension). width Output width inches. height Output height inches. res Resolution DPI raster outputs (PNG, JPEG, TIFF). Default 600. ... Additional arguments passed layout functions.

title: Base R Graphics Network Plotting — splot
text: Invisibly returns cograph_network object.

title: Base R Graphics Network Plotting — splot
text: Edge curving controlled three parameters interact: curves Mode automatic curving. FALSE = straight, TRUE (default) = curve reciprocal edge pairs ellipse, "force" = curve edges inward toward network center. curvature Manual curvature amount (0-1 typical). Sets magnitude curves. Default 0 uses automatic 0.175 curved edges. Positive values curve edges; direction automatically determined. curve_scale currently used; reserved future scaling. reciprocal edges (->B B->exist), edges curve opposite directions form visual ellipse, making bidirectional relationships clear.

title: Base R Graphics Network Plotting — splot
text: Controls edge weights mapped visual widths: linear (default) Width proportional weight. Best weights similar magnitude. log Logarithmic scaling. Best weights span multiple orders magnitude (e.g., 0.01 100). sqrt Square root scaling. Moderate compression, good moderately skewed distributions. rank Rank-based scaling. Ignores actual values; uses relative ordering. edges get equal visual spacing regardless weight distribution.

what: Donut vs Pie vs Double Donut
title: Base R Graphics Network Plotting — splot
text: Three ways show additional data nodes: Donut (donut_fill) Single ring showing proportion (0-1). Ideal completion rates, probabilities, single metric per node. Use donut_color fill color donut_bg_color unfilled portion. Pie (pie_values) Multiple colored segments showing category breakdown. Ideal composition data. Values normalized sum 1. Use pie_colors segment colors. Double Donut (donut2_values) Two concentric rings comparing two metrics per node. Outer ring uses donut_fill/donut_color, inner ring uses donut2_values/donut2_colors.

title: Base R Graphics Network Plotting — splot
text: Confidence interval underlays draw wider, semi-transparent edge behind main edge visualize uncertainty: edge_ci Vector CI widths (0-1 scale). Larger = uncertainty. edge_ci_scale Multiplier underlay width relative main edge. Default 2 means underlay twice wide main edge CI=1. edge_ci_alpha Transparency underlay (0-1). Default 0.15. edge_ci_style Line type: 1=solid, 2=dashed (default), 3=dotted.

title: Base R Graphics Network Plotting — splot
text: statistical output, use templates format complex labels: edge_label_template Template string placeholders: {est} estimate/weight, {low}/{} CI bounds, {range} formatted range, {p} p-value, {stars} significance stars. edge_label_style Preset styles: "estimate" (weight ), "full" (estimate + CI), "range" (CI ), "stars" (significance).

title: Base R Graphics Network Plotting — splot
code: # Basic network from adjacency matrix adj <- matrix(c(0, 1, 1, 0,                 0, 0, 1, 1,                 0, 0, 0, 1,                 0, 0, 0, 0), 4, 4, byrow = TRUE) splot(adj)   # With curved edges splot(adj, curvature = 0.2)  # Weighted network with colors w_adj <- matrix(c(0, 0.5, -0.3, 0,                   0.8, 0, 0.4, -0.2,                   0, 0, 0, 0.6,                   0, 0, 0, 0), 4, 4, byrow = TRUE) splot(w_adj, edge_positive_color = "darkgreen", edge_negative_color = "red")   # Pie chart nodes splot(adj, pie_values = list(c(1,2,3), c(2,2), c(1,1,1,1), c(3,1)))   # Circle layout with labels splot(adj, layout = "circle", labels = c("A", "B", "C", "D"))
